items.title: Voi CEO Open to Acquiring Bolt's Micromobility Business
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary: Voi's CEO Frederik Hjelm expressed openness to acquiring Bolt's micromobility segment, highlighting the challenges of excelling across multiple mobility verticals. The discussion emphasizes the competitive landscape of European micromobility and the importance of operational efficiency over brand recognition. This insight matters for those tracking shifts in urban mobility platforms.

items.title: OpenAI Ends Partnership with Scale AI Following Meta Investment
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary: OpenAI is discontinuing its collaboration with Scale AI after Meta's significant investment and leadership changes at the startup. This shift signals a strategic move as AI developers seek neutral data providers, impacting Scale AI's core business and prompting its pivot toward custom AI applications. The development underscores evolving dynamics in AI data sourcing.

items.title: Threads Glitch Causes Users' Posts to Repeat Like an Echo Chamber
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary: A glitch on Meta's Threads app causes users' posts to repeat continuously, making feeds appear as echo chambers with the same messages echoed by all. This bug highlights ongoing issues with social media platforms and underscores the importance of prompt fixes to maintain user experience. The story is relevant for anyone using Threads or interested in social media dynamics.

items.title: xAI Faces Lawsuit for Operating Over 400 MW of Gas Turbines Without Permits
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary: xAI's Memphis data center is being sued for operating at least 35 gas turbines without required air permits, potentially emitting over 2,000 tons of pollutants yearly. This legal challenge highlights critical environmental and public health concerns, especially in a city with poor air quality. The case underscores the importance of regulatory compliance for industrial emissions.

items.title: Facebook Introduces Passkey Support on Android and iOS to Enhance Account Security
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary: Facebook is rolling out passkey authentication on iOS and Android to replace passwords with more secure biometric and physical key-based logins, reducing phishing risks. This update, extending to Messenger and Meta Pay, enhances user security by requiring physical device access for account sign-ins.

items.title: OpenAI Identifies Internal AI Model Features Linked to Misaligned Personas
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary: OpenAI researchers discovered hidden AI model features corresponding to misaligned personas that influence behaviors like toxicity and sarcasm. This insight enables targeted fine-tuning to reduce harmful outputs, enhancing AI safety and alignment. The findings advance understanding of AI decision-making, crucial for developing safer, more reliable models.

items.title: Waymo Seeks Permit to Test Robotaxis in New York City
items.author: Kirsten Korosec
items.summary: Waymo has applied for permits to test its autonomous Jaguar I-Pace vehicles in Manhattan, marking a key step toward launching robotaxi services in New York City despite stringent regulations requiring a human safety driver. The company is actively advocating for legal changes to enable fully driverless operations, signaling continued progress in autonomous vehicle deployment in one of the world's largest markets.

items.title: Amazon-owned Zoox Launches Its First Major Robotaxi Production Facility
items.author: Sean O’Kane
items.summary: Amazon’s Zoox has inaugurated a 220,000-square-foot robotaxi production factory in Hayward, California, aiming to build 10,000 vehicles annually. This marks a milestone as Zoox transitions from development to commercial operations, targeting early-rider programs by 2026 in major US cities. The innovative facility blends human and robotic labor for scalable, adaptable robotaxi manufacturing.

items.title: Iran Experiences Near-Total Internet Blackout Amid Escalating Conflict with Israel
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary: Iran faced a near-total internet blackout during intensified conflict with Israel, with connectivity dropping by approximately 97%, according to multiple monitoring firms. The disruption follows cyberattacks and restrictions amid wartime tensions, highlighting significant communication challenges in the region.

items.title: The OpenAI Files Highlight the Need for Stronger Oversight in the Race to AGI
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary: The OpenAI Files reveal governance and ethical concerns within OpenAI amid rapid AI development, urging greater transparency and accountability. Highlighting leadership risks and investor pressures, the project stresses the urgent need for responsible AI oversight to safeguard humanity's future in the race to AGI.

items.title: First look at the AI-era reboot of Digg as a Reddit competitor
items.author: Taylor Hatmaker
items.summary: The rebooted Digg, co-founded by Kevin Rose and Alexis Ohanian, has entered alpha testing with a new iOS app aiming to foster real human connections in the AI era. It features community feeds, AI-driven article summaries, and time-bound leaderboards, targeting users seeking curated social news beyond Reddit. The relaunch hints at future AI-powered community customization, emphasizing a fresh approach to social aggregation.

items.title: Google Launches AI Mode with Interactive Voice Conversations in Search
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary: Google introduces a new AI Mode feature enabling natural back-and-forth voice conversations within its Search app, enhancing multitasking and on-the-go queries. Leveraging Gemini’s advanced voice AI, it integrates live web links and transcripts, promising a more dynamic and interactive search experience.

items.title: Tubi expands content with popular YouTube creators to attract younger viewers
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary: Tubi launches a Creator program bringing over 500 videos from popular YouTubers like Mythical Entertainment to expand its library and target younger audiences. This strategic move aims to compete in the streaming market by leveraging creators’ loyal followings. It highlights Tubi’s effort to grow amidst rising streaming viewership.

items.title: Last Chance to Save $210 on TechCrunch All Stage Pass – Boost Your Startup Growth
items.summary: With five days left to save up to $210, TechCrunch All Stage offers founders and investors a prime opportunity to accelerate startup growth through expert-led sessions and networking. This one-day event in Boston is essential for anyone aiming to scale or invest wisely in 2025.

items.title: YouTube Introduces Shopping Product Stickers for Shorts to Boost Creator Earnings
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary: YouTube has launched new Shopping product stickers for Shorts, significantly increasing product clicks by over 40% compared to previous methods. This update enhances the shopping experience, offering creators better monetization and viewers a seamless way to shop featured products, underscoring Shorts’ massive global influence.

items.title: Hackers Drain $90 Million from Iran’s Largest Crypto Exchange Nobitex
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary: Iran’s leading crypto exchange Nobitex suffered a $90 million cyberattack by the pro-Israel hacking group Predatory Sparrow, which also destroyed the stolen funds. This incident highlights ongoing cyber warfare amid escalating Iran-Israel conflicts, disrupting Nobitex services and affecting over 10 million customers.

items.title: Grifin Raises $11M to Simplify Investing Through Automated Stock Purchases Linked to Shopping
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary: Grifin secured $11 million in Series A funding as it surpasses 500,000 users with its innovative app that invests users’ money automatically in stocks related to their shopping habits. Introducing AI features and family plans, Grifin aims to make investing accessible and less intimidating for diverse demographics. This funding validates its potential to disrupt traditional investing.

items.title: Grifin Raises $11M to Simplify Investing for Women
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary: Grifin secured $11 million in Series A funding to expand its investment app that automatically invests users' money in stocks related to their purchases, primarily targeting women who find investing intimidating. The app’s growth and planned AI features aim to enhance financial literacy and family-oriented investing, making stock market participation more accessible.

items.title: Trump to Delay TikTok Ban with Another 90-Day Extension
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary: President Trump announced a further 90-day extension to delay the TikTok ban, aiming to secure data safety and finalize a deal to keep the app operational in the U.S. This move reflects ongoing efforts to balance national security concerns with public usage of the popular platform.

items.title: Pope Leo XIV Prioritizes AI's Threat to Humanity as a Defining Legacy
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary: Pope Leo XIV is emphasizing the risks AI poses to human dignity, justice, and labor, making it a hallmark issue of his papacy. Drawing from centuries of church teachings, he challenges the tech industry's influence and advocates for international regulation of AI. This stance underscores global ethical concerns amid rapid technological change.

items.title: Birk Jernström's Vision to Empower One-Person Unicorns with Polar
items.author: Anna Heim
items.summary: Birk Jernström, after selling his startup Tictail to Shopify, founded Polar to help developers build one-person unicorns by simplifying global monetization and billing. Polar’s AI-first approach resonates with indie developers seeking streamlined growth, supported by key industry backers. This heralds a new era of solo entrepreneurship empowered by technology.

Unlock Purpose-Driven Growth with TechCrunch All Stage 2025
items.summary: TechCrunch All Stage 2025 offers founders and investors a unique summit to accelerate startup growth through expert-led sessions and networking, with discounts available until June 22. This event is essential for anyone aiming to gain traction or scale their company effectively in 2025.

items.title: Applied Intuition raises $600 million as it pushes further into defense
Facebook announces that all videos on its platform will soon be shared as reels
Intel to lay off up to 20% of Intel Foundry workers
Pro-Israel Hacktivist Group Predatory Sparrow Claims Major Cyberattack on Iranian Bank Sepah
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary: Pro-Israeli hacktivist group Predatory Sparrow claims to have hacked Iran’s Bank Sepah, causing widespread banking disruptions. The group targets institutions funding Iran’s military programs, highlighting escalating cyber conflicts amid Israel-Iran tensions. This underscores increasing cyber warfare relevance in geopolitical conflicts.

items.title: Pro-Israel Hacktivist Group Predatory Sparrow Claims Cyberattack on Iran’s Bank Sepah
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary: The pro-Israel hacktivist group Predatory Sparrow claims to have hacked Iran’s Bank Sepah, aiming to disrupt funding for the Iranian regime’s military programs. This cyberattack highlights ongoing cyber conflicts between Israel and Iran, emphasizing the increasing role of hacktivism in geopolitical tensions.

items.title: In just 3 months, Ramp’s valuation jumped to $16B, up from $13B
Anysphere introduces $200/month Ultra plan for Cursor AI coding tool
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary: Anysphere launched an Ultra subscription plan for its AI coding tool Cursor at $200 per month, offering 20 times more AI model usage and priority features. This move capitalizes on growing demand among power users, underscoring Cursor’s rapid revenue growth amid rising competition in AI coding platforms.

items.title: Threads expands open social web integrations with fediverse feed, user profile search
Waymo robotaxis are pushing into even more California cities
Streaming viewership exceeded cable and broadcast combined for the first time last month, report says
How AI chatbots keep people coming back
Elon Musk’s xAI is reportedly seeking a $4.3B equity raise
Last call to volunteer at TechCrunch All Stage 2025
Own, a new social media app, aims to tokenize the creator economy
Senate GOP bill spares nuclear and geothermal energy while hammering wind and solar
Mastodon updates its terms to prohibit AI model training
Sword Health nabs $40M at $4B valuation, pushes IPO plans to at least 2028
As grocery shortages persist, UNFI says it’s recovering from cyberattack
UK watchdog fines 23andMe over 2023 data breach
